items.name: Bard's Cape
items.description: A cape from the Dev Gods themselves, it was given to explorers who went into the forest and snooped around, finding new adventures to be had. It features a colorful array of various hues and decorations, normally worn by musicians in taverns. Someone wearing one of these capes has clearly appeased the gods, and shown their dedication to the lands.
items.wikiNote: Drop info missing, needs error checking
items.wikiFreeText:
=Acquisition=
The devs gave this cape to some of the lucky players, as thanks for their successful contribution of quest texts. The quest texts were eventually used in the game.

These lucky players were greeted with the following message in their ChatWarsBot.
 Tonight is the night. This night you were blessed by the gods. They decided to come down and gift you, PlayerName, with a cheese basket. The catch is, this basket is not made out of cheese and it's not even a basket.
  
 Right now it includes:
 :Present: Assistant box x 1
 Bard's Cape x 1

items.name: Battle knife
items.description: Another knife stolen from the castle's kitchen, except this one was stolen by a blacksmith with a lot of time, and stolen knives. A  spiked, curved band of yellow metal covers the wielder's fingers and extends to the bolster of the Kitchen Knife. The spine of the blade has been filed down to form serrating teeth, adding an intimidation factor.

items.name: ðŸ’ŒBlank Valentine Card
items.freeText: It can be used with /use_bvc {user_id} {message} to send a Valentine's message to a user with the given telegram id.

items.name: Blessed Cloak
items.description: A cloak designed to give praise to the Dev Gods, it features gems outlining the edges of the orange and yellow fabric, representing fire. In the center is their class, requesting a prayer to buff their stats, but nerf the class they dislike the most. Some users sew designs of hammers, silouettes of girls, meat, or foam darts into the free space.
items.freeText: It was introduced with the [[Game updates/2018-06-30|June 30th, 2018 game update]].

items.freeText: [[Arrow]] are required for [[Bow|bows]]. They are obtained by opening a [[Bodkin Arrows Pack]].

items.name: Bone club
items.description: Two deer skulls are attached at the back of the head by a string tied through the eye sockets. Then, a thick, sanded down Club is inserted and clamped onto the back of each skull, engulfing the wood with the skulls and locking it in place. Useful for bashing, stabbing, and swinging, barbarians AND goths alike envy having a weapon like this.

items.freeText: This potion does not work for Esquire classes, as they do not possess any mana.

items.name: Bottle of Morph
items.wikiNote: needs weight added and error checking
items.effect: Decreases [[Character#Stats|base stats]] by 20% and swaps them (Attack becomes Defense and vice versa)
items.wikiFreeText:
=Note=
Being morphed swaps base stats and reduces them by 35%; Bottle of morph restores them by +15%, finally giving 20% reduced stats.

* When stacked together with a [[Vial of Morph]], the final stat reduction is 15%.
* When stacked together with a [[Potion of Morph]], the final stat reduction is 10%.
* When stacked together with both [[Vial of Morph|Vial]] and [[Potion of Morph|Potion]] of morph, the final stat reduction is 5%.

items.name: Bronze shield
items.description: A beginner defender's speciality. A mix of 1:1 copper and tin are smelted together, to form a stronger material. Cast in the shape of a kite, it has 4 distinct panels held in place by curving the edges over the individual plates. About the size of the user's torso, it provides excellent protection, but is still a light material for learning hands.

items.name: Chain mail
items.description: Individual iron rings, curved slightly come together to form a full torso mesh. Protecting the neck, arms, and full torso, its definitely an armor piece to reckon with. Best against arrows, the mail clinks with every step, light on your body compared to normal plate armor.

items.freeText: It was introduced with the [[Advanced Crafting]] update.

items.name: Champion Sword
items.description: A sword with high honors, it has a mithril core with an edge made of ruby. The outer metal holster has a brilliant silver sheen, outlined by the red of the cutting edge. About 4 feet long, the daunting blade is considered a longsword. With a pure gold crossguard and hilt, wrapped in a thick red twine, its envied by duelists and show-offs
items.freeText: It was added to the game with the April 3, 2018 update.

items.name: Champion Sword recipe
items.freeText: It was introduced with the [[Advanced Crafting]] update.

items.name: Chaos Stone
items.wikiNote: needs maybe extra template stuff for better support
items.freeText:
Used to reroll the entire stat and effect field (new effect types, as well as classes) for rings and amulets. Can also be used to reroll the modifiers of [[Nomenclature|T5 Gear]].

It can be found in events, by completing guild quests or crafted with [[Chaos Stone Shard|chaos stone shards]].

items.name: ðŸ«Chocolate
items.freeText: '''Chocolate''' is an event item from the historical event [[Valentines Day 2018]] that could be rewarded from eating [[Cake|cake]]. It was reintroduced with the [[Trade Union Event 2019]] and was a possible reward from boxes there. It may also be found in a [[Seasonal Box]]. Chocolate is a consumable item that gives the player one :Stamina: stamina, but not increasing the maximum amount of stamina.

items.name: Clarity Circlet
items.description: A young branch from a moss tree, spun around a thin branch of oak, meet in the middle to house two small sapphires, and one regular sized in the center. Easily tightened or loosened by unraveling some branch, it fits snugly to a user's head to help them relax and find their inner Mana. How it works? We dunno.
items.freeText: It was added to the game with the April 3, 2018 update.
items.wikiFreeText:
=Note=
Once enchanted, it can be wrapped using only 1 [[Wrap]] instead of 3

items.name: Clarity Robe
items.description: Ancient in style, this robe is based on earlier sorcerers who roamed. Favored by Masters, it helps strengthen a wearer's ability to channel their inner Mana. White colored cloth is blessed and enchanted before being sewn together into a robe. Hanging down to the knees and covering up to the elbows, it protects spiritually rather than physically.
items.freeText: It was added to the game with the April 3, 2018 update.

items.name: Cloth jacket
items.description: A simple blend of similar fabrics, overlapping to provide thin defense against slashing. Cotton, wool, and linen layers wound together overlap the torso and upper arms, buttoning to close and envelop the user for warmth and protection

items.name: Club
items.description: A basic weapon in any warriors arsenal, this one goes back hundreds, even thousands of years. A stone is hammered and drilled, and a stick is inserted snugly into the hole. After insertion, it is fastened with twine and cord to keep it on. You almost feel scammed, paying 62 gold for such a basic weapon.

items.name: Composite Bow
items.description: An experimental blend of plants burned to ash, tree resin, intense thermal chilling, and wood dust, the result is a natural weapon made from nature. Some users pride themselves in not using any metal, and is certainly an achievement for the thrifty archer. Capable of firing Steel Arrows, it certainly stands up to the other bows on the same tier.

items.name: Crusader Armor
items.description: Bearing the emblem of your castle on its chest, the two layered armor has a mix of mithril-chainmain similar to the Hunter Armor on the inside, but against the body is a sewn cloth layer for protection. Having good protection and a light weight, it gives a good balance of Light and Heavy for the bold defender who leaves their wall.

items.wikiFreeText:
=Flavor Text=
 A whip inspired by the fiends of Hell, this whip's goal is to maim and break whatever it strikes. Red, volcanic stone is made into hollow cylinders and put over a black leather weave, before meeting at a ball like tip. Did you know a whip can crack at over 767 MPH / 1,275 km/h? Now imagine that made of stone, striking a skull or bone. Devilish, no?

items.name: Doomblade Sword
items.description: The Doomblade Sword gets its name due to the way its manufactured. A steel blade is forged with coke, to give it a black color. After cooling, acid is applied to the blade, coloring and hardening the metal through chemistry. The case hardened finish is a mix of a dark gold, light blue, red and brown, all the way down the black blade.
items.freeText: It was introduced with the [[Game_updates/2018-06-30|June 30th, 2018 game update]].

items.name: Dragon Mace
items.description: Breaking the norm, the Dragon Mace is decorated with teeth like spikes, mounted on a solid, fist sized orb. Each spike is curled slightly, giving a gnarled, rough appearance to the weapon. The shaft, only about a foot long, is decorated in a dragon like design, which wraps around the handle and curls off the grip in a tail like shape.

items.name: Dragon Mace head

items.name: Duality Bottle
items.effect: Swaps base stats with the [[Rebirth|/mes]] (secondary class) ones and decreases them by 20%. (Only for mem Players)
items.wikiFreeText:
=Note=
Duality changes base stats and reduces them by 35%; Duality Bottle restores them by +15%, giving a net stat reduction of 20%

* When stacked together with a [[Duality Vial]], the final stat reduction is 15%.
* When stacked together with a [[Duality Potion]] the final stat reduction is 10%.
* When stacked together with [[Duality Vial]] and [[Duality Potion]], the net stat reduction is 5%.

items.name: Duality Potion
items.effect: Swaps base stats with the [[Rebirth|/mes]] (secondary class) ones and decreases them by 25%. (Only for mem Players)
items.wikiFreeText:
=Note=
Duality changes base stats and reduces them by 35%; Duality Potion restores them by +10%, giving a net stat reduction of 25%

* When stacked together with a [[Duality Vial]], the final stat reduction is 20%.
* When stacked together with a [[Duality Bottle]] the final stat reduction is 10%.
* When stacked together with [[Duality Vial]] and [[Duality Bottle]], the net stat reduction is 5%.

items.name: Duality Vial
items.effect: Swaps base stats with the [[Rebirth|/mes]] (secondary class) ones and decreases them by 30%. (Only for mem Players)
items.wikiFreeText:
=Note=
Duality changes base stats and reduces them by 35%; Duality Vial restores them by +5%, giving a net stat reduction of 30%

* When stacked together with a [[Duality Potion]], the final stat reduction is 20%.
* When stacked together with a [[Duality Bottle]] the final stat reduction is 15%.
* When stacked together with [[Duality Potion]] and [[Duality Bottle]], the net stat reduction is 5%.

items.name: Durable Cloak
items.description: A reinforced cloak designed for stealth. The inside of it has leather for warmth, while the exterior has cloth. Based on the colors or designs stitched in, the wearer can choose a wide variety of different custom capes. However, no matter the colors, designs or elbems, it's still classified as a durable cloak due to the leather reinforcement.
items.freeText: It was introduced in the [[Game updates/2018-06-30|June 30th, 2018 game update]].

items.name: Eclipse
items.description: Nicknamed Eclipse, the blade resembles that of a Khopesh. It starts off straight, before turning away from the user in a reverse sickle shape. The sword follows traditional design, but reforged in iron, as the resource is better compared to the normal bronze. Useful for getting behind shields,  anyone who uses it is well rehearsed on the benefits.
items.freeText: It was introduced with the [[Game_updates/2018-06-30|June 30th, 2018 game update]].

items.name: Elven Bow
items.description: A normal Wooden Bow is reinforced with metal similar to that of the Order Armor, and redesigned to match earlier models. Small winglets are added to the bow's limbs to extend its reach and energy storing power.  Several engravings can be made to enhance the aestetic, but most users tend to keep the bow default as a nod to ancestors in the land
items.freeText: To use the {{PAGENAME}}, {{#show: {{PAGENAME}} |?Ammunition}} needs to be equipped in the Off Hand Weapon slot.

items.name: Elven spear
items.description: Like any other spear, a head is cast and attached to a polearm for grip. Except, the head and pole are one piece, with wood added later for detail and grip. The head is shaped in an X shape, with sharp blades angled to make hooks, daring to be yanked out of an enemy.. Most wooden grips are dyed to represent castle colors.

items.name: Elven sword
items.description: Using the same metal as Order Armor, this bronze colored sword pays tribute to the ancient warriors. Curved like a schimitar but thin as a katana, the sword is like a razor. The handle features a circular hand guard, and a cross guard that curls off into a vine like shape on both sides. With care, this blade can last for many more decades.

items.freeText:
Used to reroll only the stats (values of effects) for rings and amulets. Can also be used to reroll stats for the modifiers of [[Nomenclature|T5 Gear]].

It can be found in events, by completing guild quests or crafted with [[Force Stone Shard|force stone shards]].

items.freeText: The {{PAGENAME}} can be acquired by opening [[Seasonal Box|Seasonal Boxes]].

items.name: Forest Bow
items.description: The best bow you can get before metalworking is needed. A tree blessed by a priest is cut down and sanded, before being coated in wax. The branches are wrapped around in a coil, before being notched and tied with a metallic thread. Some users report feeling spiritually aware while using the weapon, but the reason why is unknown.
items.freeText: To use the {{PAGENAME}}, {{#show: {{PAGENAME}} |?Ammunition}} needs to be equipped in the Off Hand Weapon slot.

items.name: Ghost Armor
items.description: A metalworking masterpiece, the ghost armor is truly a mystery how it was concieved and forged. Made of a snow white, but seemingly translucent metal, the wear's skin is almost visible beneath, but thin, whisps creep off the exterior in a fog like censor. Plates in the chest are held together by a stretchy, synthetic fabric.
items.freeText: It was introduced with the [[Game updates/2018-06-30|June 30th, 2018 game update]].

items.description: Made from Crafted Leather, the boots have the complexity of normal metal based boots but the simplicity of leather. Cut and shaped, the dyed snow white boots envelop the users foot and sparkle lightly, freshly filed Sapphire worked into the Crafted Leather. Sewn down the medial side and matching.

items.name: Ghost Gloves
items.description: Similar to regular Gloves, they appear to be made of wool. Except, having 2 layers of Metallic Fiber and 3 layers of Crafted Leather spun thin as twine, and dyed white and sprinkled with filed Sapphire for a glittery effect. Similar to a trick, anyone who fails to recognize this type of glove is in for a real treat, or a stabbing.

items.name: Ghost Helmet
items.description: An eerie translucent metal, the users face is visible through the faceplate similar to the metal of the Armor or rest of helmet. Shaped like a skull, it has an outwards curve in the rear before following the inward vertical indent of the neck. Entirely closed off, both the viewer and enemies can view inwards to see eachother in the face of combat.

items.description: Simple wool gloves, with holes for 5 digits. Extending to the wrist, it provides mild protection from cold and blades alike. Mostly for show, the white pair are clean, and ready for battle.

items.name: Guard's Spear
items.description: A highly decorated weapon, usually used by the castle's watchmen who, coincidentally, guard the castle on their offtime. Similar to a grappling hook, it features 4 prongs that meet in a + shape, and curl backwards like barbs. Some users decorate the head with chains or decorative cloths, showing pride in their castle and work.

items.name: Hailstorm Bow
items.description: Designed by castle leaders and war generals, the Hailstorm Bow was taken from the idea of a blizzard. Capable of using Steel Arrows, arrows are polished until glistening, and shot in a snowstorm like hail of arrows. The bow itself is a wrap of milkstone and a mithril base, providing more power and flexibility than the tier below it.

items.name: Halberd
items.description: If you decapitated an axe and sewed the severed head to a spear, you'd get a halberd. Capable of being swung to bash against shields and lunged to stab enemies, its a relatively low cost weapon to produce with a lot of ability.Whether defending or attacking... both raiders and sentinels cherish and fear this combination.

items.name: Hamsters
items.freeText: Hamsters is [[Pet]] food for [[Owl]], [[Haunted]] and [[Spider]] pets.

items.name: Hat
items.description: A head enveloping, animal fur covered, hat similar to an ushanka or papakha, it cups your head and covers your ears for warmth. Black in color, it has a furry exterior with a circular cap ontop. It doesnâ€™t do much for protection, but it's better than nothing.

items.wikiFreeText: '''{{PAGENAME}}''' is a consumable item that is needed to feed [[Pet|pets]] of the type [[Horse]]. =Acquisition= {{PAGENAME}} can be bought in the :Paws: Menagerie of the [[Shop]] for 1 :Gem: with the commande /buy_{{#show: {{PAGENAME}}| ?ItemID}} or can be possible loot for succesful [[Foray|forays]]. {{PAGENAME}} can also be traded in the exchange with /t_{{#show: {{PAGENAME}}| ?ItemID}}

items.name: Heavy arrow
items.freeText: [[Arrow]] are required for [[Bow|bows]]. They are obtained by opening a [[Heavy Arrows Pack]].

items.name: Heavy arrows pack
items.wikiNote: new tier, missing lots of info
items.freeText: When opened with /use_517 it yields 100 [[Heavy Arrow|Heavy Arrows]]. Arrow packs can only be crafted and not traded in any way.

items.name: Heavy club
items.description: The first club made of metal, it sets the standard for blacksmiths and warriors alike. Two blocks of metal are cast in an L shape, then placed ontop of eachother. A treaded metal rod is inserted, then the tip is capped with a ball, producing a seemingly one piece hammer. With 2 surfaces for swinging, some users add spikes for armor penetration.

items.name: Heavy Fauchard
items.wikiNote: wrapping and enchantment info still missing

items.name: Hiking Bag
items.description: A normal sack made of leather, except detailed with extra pockets, both on the inside and outside. A number of loops, buckles, fasteners and buttons are at the users aid, increasing their backpage storage space, for more items to hold. Brown in color, it certainly beats the saddlebags of the far lands, who had to wear the horse saddle.
items.freeText: It is a possible drop from [[Zombie Box]] and increases the inventory space :Bag: by 5.

items.name: Hiking Jar
items.description: A jar made for storing food for trips, the Hiking jar can be filled with meats or nuts, depending on user tastes. Using this jar enables the holder to go out on more trips, seemingly increasing their stamina while they wield it. A normal mason jar, with a screw on cap and a ribbon for identification, anyone lucky enough to have one cherishes it
items.freeText: It is a possible drop from [[Zombie Box]] and increases the maximum stamina :Stamina: by 2.

items.name: Hunter Boots
items.description: Layers of steel and mithril are laid over eachother to provide a firm base, which is then milled and slotted to provide a leather wrap. With triangle shaped plates added to the top of the boot, a scale like design is placed in an intimidating fashion. This lightweight armor is essentially a hybrid, maximizing speed and agility, with protection.

items.name: Hunter Bow
items.description: Much like the matching armor, the Hunter Bow aims for lightweight use. Mithril is forged with iron internals, to allow more flexibility rather than having a solid piece of metal bend, and roped off with a thicker piece of metal twine. Being too strong for Wooden Arrows, Steel Arrows are recommended for use.

items.name: Hunter Bow recipe
items.freeText: It was introduced in the [[Advanced Crafting]] update.

items.name: Hunter dagger
items.description: Taking motivation from the chestpiece of the same set, the mithril blade is more advanced than the castle shop's dagger. Shaped like a kitchen knife, one side has a blade, while the other side is a ripple of serrated, thick, bent teeth. Exceeding in stabbing, slashing, hacking and even sawing, the Hunter Dagger takes those off guard with ease.
items.freeText: It was added to the game with the April 3, 2018 update.

items.description: A rather basic helmet, picking and choosing from the lower tiers to bring all the bests into one. With the design of a mithril and the comfort of leather, the helmet can be attached to the armor and removed swiftly. Rather than being fully attached, it has 2 leather straps with buttons that attach to the shoulders of the Hunter Armor.

items.description: A standard Steel Axe, except for the ruby edge. The blade end has been flattened and replaced with a ruby edge. Having two sides of flat steel, it allows the user to have some creativity. Whether its a vine, forest scenery, or their own castle, each axe is a weapon up the sleeve of anyone willing to wield it.

items.name: King's Defender
items.description: The King's Defender is a tribute to the castle of which it was made. The metal, dyed and mixed with natural elements during forging, is left in castle complementary colors, and smithed with the honors of castle leadership. Recognizeable by the colors, its also customized by the warriors of each castle in any prideful way they seem fit. Cheers!
items.wikiNote: first draft of new forms page to fix '

items.name: Kitchen knife
items.description: Simply put, someone stole this from the castle's kitchen. A foot long blade pokes out of a sanded wooden handle, attached through 2 tangs that hold the wood. Despite being used to cut fruit and veggies, it can easily cut enemies if in the right hand, dug between armor plates or stabbed in a side.

items.name: Knight's sword
items.description: An antique item, many of these exist, but their value is treasured. These swords are  refurbished before being resold to new warriorsâ€¦ almost like a blessing. With a rich, golden colored cross guard and a grip of ancient twine and cord of varying earthy colors, it makes you wonder who owned this before you, and what battles this sword has seen?

items.name: Lance
items.description: Popular among horse riding Princes of the castle, the long, thin rod is great for spearing at high speeds. Sadly, you aren't a Prince. A 5 foot pole decorated with white and red paint in a twisting motion reminds you of the yearly parades. Great for forcing an enemy to keep their distance, a user is easily overwhelmed if the gap is closed.

items.name: Leash
items.wikiNote: needs sale price (is it sellable?). needs template/modification of template to display all info?
items.freeText: With a leash you can put your [[Pet|pet]] into [[Pet#Sheltering|shelter]].

items.name: Leather
items.freeText: Half of a leather hide folded over, cut down the middle and sewn at the chin, a simple cowl is produced. Brown and color and thin, it drapes over the sides of your head and covers your neck. With the benefit of being waterproof and light weight, its great for disguising or concealing your identity.

items.name: Leather gloves
items.description: Small strips of leather curled into finger sized rolls, stitched to two connecting pads. In the shape of a hand, they're stitched to close your hands and provide the protection of normal armor. They're a bit gritty, and rough, but great protection for the average warrior.

items.name: Leather hood
items.description: Half of a leather hide folded over, cut down the middle and sewn at the chin, a simple cowl is produced. Brown and color and thin, it drapes over the sides of your head and covers your neck. With the benefit of being waterproof and light weight, its great for disguising or concealing your identity.

items.name: Leather shirt
items.description: Raw animal hide skinned and tanned, to create a vest like wrap to defend the user. Brown in color and one uniform piece, its better than mere fabric, but animal skin only goes so far.

items.name: Lightning Bow
items.description: Perhaps the fastest firing bow for its tier, it's nicknamed lightning respectively. Cleanly releasing energy on firing, and able to be drawn back 25% further than the Composite or Hailstorm bow, it prides itself in being able to punch through most armors. Featuring a 'tier' like design, the ripples help conserve energy in the frame.

items.description: A layer of studded Crafted leather is wrapped and 'nailed' to the internal metal plate made of Mithril and attached with fur for effect. Similar to the Cuirass, its a single egg shaped piece of armor with holes for arms, a head, and legs. On the middle is a detailed etching of a lion's head, mouth agape and biting for something, with a dark mane.

items.description: The Lion Boots are simplistic, compared to the Lion Armor and Lion Helmet. A central bracelet like leg cover meets the leg halfway up the shin, connect to an anti roll hinge, and curl downwards to cover the wearer's foot in a metallic protection. Several deep edges outlining the curves give a claw like vibe.

items.name: Lion Knife
items.description: Matching the armor of the same name, the Lion Knife has a lion theme. About 8 inches long and rocking a clip point blade, it yells for a challenger. Two lion heads sit on each side of the hilt for intimidation, rather than gems for being flashly. The golden hilt is made from real gold, glazed with a gloss to help prevent damage to the weak metal.
items.freeText: It was introduced with the [[Game updates/2018-06-30|June 30th, 2018 game update]].

items.name: Long Bow
items.description: Almost triple the size of the Wooden Bow, this is the bow chosen by the castles, for it immense power. Nearly the size of the user, an archer must be well trained to handle it. Despite being slow to reload, the large bow has power to match, able to knock a man off his horse and puncture easily through most chainmail.
items.freeText: To use the {{PAGENAME}}, {{#show: {{PAGENAME}} |?Ammunition}} needs to be equipped in the Off Hand Weapon slot.

items.name: Long spear
items.description: The best wooden spear the castle has to offer. A head is cast and hammered into shape, a near perfect, slender triangle is jointed to a wooden 6 foot staff with several dovetail joints. Locked in place, the large handle is wrapped in fabric and twine for grip, and to show popular grips, like: a middle, extended, or short grip, for tossing.

items.name: Long sword
items.description: Only for those who have mastered the short sword, and have the willpower and talent to carry a longer blade into battle. 4 feet of iron ontop of a sturdy horizontal cross guard, with a braided, wrapped handle. Lacking a holster, it's upon the user to find a way to sheath and contain the weapon when not in use.

items.name: Loyalty Trophy
items.freeText: This item is obtained a part of the [[Proof of Loyalty]] process.
items.wikiFreeText:
= Trivia =
When the tropy is obtained by a [[Guild]] it is placed in the guild stock. It can be withdrawn from there, but it cannot be deposited back.

items.name: Metallic fiber
items.freeText: It can be found in [[Quest|quests]] if the player is [[Level|level]] 40 or higher. It can also be crafted with [[Crafting (Skill)]] 3 or higher; available to [[Blacksmith|blacksmiths]] or other players through [[Master Shop|blacksmith's shops]]. It is used in crafting tier 3 :Bookblue: equipment.

items.freeText: It was introduced to the game with the [[Valentines Day 2018]] event and was removed with the end of the event. It was one of the ingredients needed to craft [[Cake|cakes]].

items.name: Mithril armor
items.description: A blue tinted armor thats top of the line for defense. Specialty crafted for the castle's best fighters, it consists of 6 plates front and back: 2 over the chest and shoulders, 2 on the stomach and middle of the back, and 2 on the waist and side area. With spaces inbetween allowing the plates to shift, it helps with user mobility in combat.

items.name: Mithril axe
items.description: Unlike the Steel Axe, the Mithril Axe has two blades, for a double edged attack. Both blades are roughly 131 degrees, and is actually a single piece of metal formed in a hour glass like shape. Most veterans have etched designs and details in the sides of the blades, featuring glorious kills and other memories with their weapons.

items.name: Mithril boots
items.description: A complete upgrade to Silver Boots, this type of boot featured anti-roll hinges on the ankles, to prevent movement left and right, and a cloth spacer around the leg to prevent moisture from entering. Along with it, theres additional metal in a lightning bolt pattern up the sole, for grip and added protection.

items.name: Mithril dagger
items.description: Top of the line for daggers found in the shop, the Catalina Blue knife is sharp as a razor, and durable enough to be hammered and bent at will. With an edge hard enough to scratch mid-grade quality steel, many warriors cherish the blade. Some models even feature a loop, capable of being strapped to a user's wrist to prevent being lost in combat.

items.name: Mithril gauntlets
items.description: Top of the line mithril is forged to provide a true glove. Thin, whispy metal sheets are laid to encase the users hand and forearm, protecting both palm and back of hand. With a ball and socket type of hinge, it permits unrestricted hand movement for ease of combat. Its the best you'll get in the castle shop.

items.name: Mithril helmet
items.description: A rather complex helmet crafted from the hardened, blue tinted metal, itâ€™s the best armor youll get before needing a speciality blacksmith. Similar to a Silver Helmet in how it's decorated with a crest of feathers, this one has a hinged eye guard and mouth protection. However, it looks rather silly when opened, but otherwise great protection.

items.name: Mithril shield
items.description: The dark blue metal of this shield is a show to the strength of Mithril. Adopting a tower like design, and a kite shape, it rests on the floor and reaches the user's chin. The oversized shield is effective in protecting the user's full body, and even enables some offense by bashing or charging a foe.
items.freeText: Unlike other [[Weapon|weapons]] the {{PAGENAME}} is listed under ''Equipment'' in the [[Shop|shop]] and not weapons, but it uses the [[Weapon|Off Hand Weapon]] slot to be equipped, as all other [[Weapon|weapons]] do.

items.description: A heavyset piece of armor with a brass like tinge, its easily compared to dwarven ingot. Decorated with glory filled eagles, intricate designs of swirls and vines, and 3 sapphires on the chest, this heavy armor is top of the line for any brute that would like to hold the line and defend their castle.

items.name: Order Helmet
items.description: Forged in two halves, they are reinforced in the middle by a strip of metal. The neck and chin are low on the user, where it connects to the armor like a metal bracket, hooking and locking to the chestpiece. 5 indivdual latches help ensure the wearer never loses their helmet, from the horde of invaders that clamber against the walls.

items.name: Order Shield
items.description: The handcrafted shield features an emblazoned emblem of your castle's symbol in gold thread, inserted into the small depths of an etching. The gold twinkles out from the bronze like overlay of the shield, triangle in shape. It sharply bends downwards, and raises in the corners to provide a wide area of protection for the castle defenders.

items.description: The Pencil of Truth fills you with vigor. Literally a pencil the size of a 7 year old, it has a black tip, wooden face, yellow body, and a fat pink eraser for a head. No one knows where these ultra rare pencils came from, but many are wanted. Owners know however, theres a secret compartment for alcohol under the eraser... bottoms up!

items.name: Potion of Morph
items.wikiNote: needs weight added and error checking
items.effect: Decreases [[Character#Stats|base stats]] by 25% and swaps them (Attack becomes Defense and vice versa)
items.wikiFreeText:
=Note=
Being morphed swaps base stats and reduces them by 35%; Potion of morph restores them by +10%, finally giving 25% reduced stats.

* When stacked together with a [[Vial of Morph]], the final stat reduction is 20%.
* When stacked together with a [[Bottle of Morph]] the final stat reduction is 10%.
* When stacked together with both [[Vial of Morph|Vial]] and [[Bottle of Morph|Bottle]] of morph, the final stat reduction is 5%.

It was introduced in the [[Halloween Event 2018]] and used again in the [[Pretender Event 2019]]

items.name: Raging Lance
items.description: Similar to the Lance in the castle shop, except overhauled.  Black and red twisted metal over a wooden base house several hooks facing the tip. When forced inside someone, the forward facing barbs help mince and grasp at flesh as it's inserted. The vamplate now has a leather hand wrap, helping the user not lose their torturous weapon in combat.

items.name: Rapier
items.description: Silver is wrapped over an iron core to give a neat appearance but strength for heavy duty use. About 4 foot long and thin, the sword is popular for half-swording, where the blade is gripped to increase control, and used like a knife. The blade is as popular for combat as it is for sport, where some dulled down swords are used in fencing.

items.name: Rare Scroll of Engraving
items.freeText: It is used to add or change a prefix to the name of a [[Equipment#Equipment slots|main hand weapon]] item. The {{PAGENAME}} can be obtained in various Events, but is not limited to the duration of said event.
items.wikiFreeText: Two scrolls (Prefix and Postfix) can`t be combined only one of the two types can be used.

The :Bookgreen: {{PAGENAME}} is a scroll that is used to [[Enchantment|enchant]] Tier 2 :Bookgreen: [[Equipment|equipment]] of the type [[Protective Gear|protective gear]] as well as all Tier 2 :Bookgreen: [[Shield|shields]].  

=Effect=
This scroll is used to enchant items of the Tier 2 :Bookgreen: quality. Enchanting an item with :Bookgreen: {{PAGENAME}} gives the item +1 :Defend: and the :Enchantment: level increases +1. Enchanting for more than +3 :Enchantment: with this scroll will not destroy the item at a failure in the process but only all previously applied enchantments. If the enchantment is succesful, the enchantment level increases normally.

items.name: Royal Armor
items.description: Rather than blend lighter, the Royal Armor is hardened. Mixing Mithril, Order Armor, and the new metallic fiber results in a new, thicker armor type the color of a starry night, like Catalina Blue. Metallic fiber is layered in the metal like concrete in rebar, providing the power to defend the walls, when all seems lost.

A steel-mithril alloy is laid flat and warped around, welded down the middle, then attached to a hinge. Unlike normal armor, the boot extends up to the knee in a curved point, helping protect the front and back of the leg.

items.name: Royal Guard Cape
items.description: Your handy dandy starter cape. Given to you by your castle leadership once you became a member of their service, you've official upgraded from villager to warrior. By your side through thick and thin, it's an item not really sought after, but remembered by many.
items.wikiFreeText: =Acquisition= When starting the game and using the button "Me" or typing /me, the player will find a short notice on the top of the message: :Exclamationmark: Please report to your captain in the castle chat. The password is ZOM ODO. ''(Note: The password is randomly generated for each player)'' Joining the linked castle chat and typing out those letters given in the password awards the player with a cape, that can be equipped next to all standard equipment. Earned: '''[[Royal Guard Cape]]'''. Check /inv to wear it. =Trivia= In earlier versions of the game the {{PAGENAME}} could be bought in the [[Shop|castle shop]] for 1 :Gold:, this got deactivated later on and now the item can only be acquired through [[Captain Arthur]].

items.name: Royal Helmet
items.description: Taking motivation from the Crusader Helmet, and adding some glory, it features a chevron shaped eye hole, pointing towards the sky. Two vent like holes, 3 thin cylindrical lines on either side, rest near the mouth piece. Featuring latches similar to the Order armor, it enables the user to make sure they keep their head in the toughest fight.
items.freeText: It was introduced with the [[Game updates/2018-06-30|June 30th, 2018 game update]].

items.name: Royal Helmet fragment
items.wikiNote: Missing drop info before conversion just 'Swamp' was specified. ToDo: Fill out all these properties

items.name: Royal Shield
items.description: Catalina blue in color, the shield is made similar to the Royal Armor, with metallic fiber reinforcing the shield. The shield is 5 feet in height, forms a half circle. The shield has 2 C shaped hooks on the left side and 2 open ended rings on the right. Before defending, users can hook shields together, and stand as one as the wall of the castle.
items.freeText: Unlike other [[Weapon|weapons]] the {{PAGENAME}} is listed under ''Equipment'' in the [[Shop|shop]] and not weapons, but it uses the [[Weapon|Off Hand Weapon]] slot to be equipped, as all other [[Weapon|weapons]] do. It was introduced with the [[Game updates/2018-06-30|June 30th, 2018 game update]].

items.name: Sandals
items.description: A thin strip of leather and cloth used as the sole of the shoe, combined with a leather coil that extends past the heel and grasps the calf. It can be tied together to be held securely, and protect the foot against minor dangers. However, leaving the lower leg and dorsum exposed is quite hazardous.

items.wikiFreeText:
The :Bookgreen: {{PAGENAME}} is a scroll that is used to [[Enchantment|enchant]] Tier 2 :Bookgreen: [[Equipment|equipment]] of the type [[Protective Gear|protective gear]] as well as all Tier 2 :Bookgreen: [[Shield|shields]].  

=Effect=
This scroll is used to enchant items of the Tier 2 :Bookgreen: quality. Enchanting an item with :Bookgreen: {{PAGENAME}} gives the item +1 :Defend: and the :Enchantment: level increases +1. Enchanting for more than +3 :Enchantment: with this scroll has the chance to break the item and all enchantments which are lost irrevocably. 

=Acquisition=

This scroll is used to enchant items of the Tier 4 :Bookorange: quality. Enchanting for more than +3 :Enchantment: with this scroll has the chance to break the item and all enchantments which are lost irrevocably.

items.name: âš¡ï¸Scroll of Sigil
items.freeText:
The Scroll of Sigil is used to change the âš¡ï¸ emoji of gear which is used to show the enchantment state of an item. The following emoji can be picked:
[[File:ScrollOfSigil_EmojiList.png]]

items.name: Short Bow
items.description: With motivation taken to the ancestors, the short bow is made from animal sinew and rawhide. Set to harden in the sun and shaped afterwards, it isn't really impressive in terms of technology. Simplistic and early to learn with, its no big surprise most experienced archers still have their first bow, which is usually the Short Bow.
items.freeText: To use the {{PAGENAME}}, {{#show: {{PAGENAME}} |?Ammunition}} needs to be equipped in the Off Hand Weapon slot.

items.name: Short spear
items.description: An iron blade is forged in an arrow shape, before a 4 foot shaft is notched, and the arrow is inserted. Then, tightened with thread and tied off, the makeshift spear is ready for combat. Regarded as the small sibling to the normal Long Spear, its still a devastating ranged weapon, to the unshielded swordsman.

items.name: Short sword
items.description: Good for beginners, the short sword is made of a metal blade, and a handle of wound up twine. Slightly shorter than the wooden training sword, it is definitely a step up from the sticks they use to practice. However, this weapon only has a single edge, unlike the 360 degree angle of attack like a Wooden Sword.

items.name: ðŸ‰Silver Aries ring
items.wikiFreeText: Gives about 8% extra hp.

items.name: Silver arrow
items.freeText: [[Arrow]] are required for [[Bow|bows]]. They are obtained by opening a [[Silver Arrows Pack]].

items.name: Silver arrows pack
items.freeText: When opened with /use_513 it yields 100 [[Silver Arrow|Silver Arrows]]. Arrow packs can only be crafted and not traded in any way.

items.name: Silver boots
items.description: A 'step' up from the steel boots, this one features all around protection. Covering the foot itself, a hinge around the ankle, and extending partly up the leg, it features overlapping plates similar to scales, to help deflect damage and ricochet any stabs.

items.name: Silver cuirass
items.description: A egg like shaped piece of armor in one piece, it protects the front and back of the user. Easy to remove compared to normal plate armor, but lacking the padding and blunt protection of other high tier armors. Some variations have abs and pecs carved into them, to intimidate enemies

items.name: Silver dagger
items.description: With a shimmer under light, the higher quality metal twinkles with wealth. About 7'' and sharpened on both sides, the short blade is a good backup. Normally attached at the hip or tucked in a boot, most people opt for a dagger sidearm. Some experienced warriors even apply an acid to add dazzling colors, and case harden the knife.

items.name: Silver dust
items.freeText: It was added to the game with the [[Game updates/2018-06-16 | June 16th, 2018 game update]].

items.name: Silver frame
items.freeText: It was introduced in the [[Game updates/2018-06-30|June 30th, 2018 game update]]. It is used in crafting tier 3 :Bookblue: equipment.

items.name: Silver gauntlets
items.description: Three plates laid on the forearm, top of hand, and a rectangular sheet on the wrist, meet with a hinge around the wrist to allow simplstic movements. Fully encased in silver and leather, the user has the benefit of gloves and the protection of silver!

items.name: ðŸŒ‘Silver Gemini ring
items.wikiFreeText: Gives about 8% extra hp.

items.name: Silver helmet
items.description: An official helmet sponsored by the castle, silver ore is forged to a high purity, then a miniscule amount of carbon is added for strength. Shiny, gray, and decorated with a colorful crest of feathers, itâ€™s a highly honored piece of armor.

items.name: Silver ore
items.freeText: It is mainly rewarded for the [[Quest|quest]] [[Valley]] :Valley: in high amounts.

items.name: Silver shield
items.description: Shinier than any iron or steel, silver is the choice of those who have the skill to use it, but lack the funds for a Mithril. The gray metal is heated up and folded several times, in the shape of a kite. Raised on the top edges and lowered in the middle of the bottom half, it easily protects the user from ranged and melee alike.
items.freeText: Unlike other [[Weapon|weapons]] the {{PAGENAME}} is listed under ''Equipment'' in the [[Shop|shop]] and not weapons, but it uses the [[Weapon|Off Hand Weapon]] slot to be equipped, as all other [[Weapon|weapons]] do.

items.name: ðŸºSilver Taurus amulet
items.wikiFreeText: Gives about 8% extra hp.

items.name: Sinister Ranseur
items.wikiNote: higher enchantment info missing (only 1st one is there)

items.name: Skeleton Buckler
items.description: Similar to the Wooden Shield, a wooden base is made with treated boards and then nailed together. However, the final exterior of the shield is fastened with wire, twine, and several large bones. Ranging from deer, to humans, to other small animals, the wood finish is covered in white. Barbaric in nature, the bones invite your enemies to join them.
items.freeText: Unlike other [[Weapon|weapons]] the {{PAGENAME}} is listed under ''Equipment'' in the [[Shop|shop]] and not weapons, but it uses the [[Weapon|Off Hand Weapon]] slot to be equipped, as all other [[Weapon|weapons]] do.

items.name: Skull Crusher
items.description: The Skull Crusher features a mushroom shaped hammer head, which pans out before returning inwards on a central stalk. Attached to the mushroom lips are several inch long blades, wide for blunt, penetrating power when swung. About 5 feet long, the Skull Crusher invites users to drop their shield and bash others... both shields, and people.

items.name: Skull Crusher head
items.wikiNote: Missing drop info before conversion just 'Swamp' was specified. ToDo: Fill out all these properties
items.freeText: It was introduced in the [[Game updates/2018-06-30|June 30th, 2018 game update]].

items.name: Skull Crusher recipe
items.freeText: It was introduced in the [[Game updates/2018-06-30|June 30th, 2018 game update]].

items.name: Solvent
items.freeText: It is used in the crafting of Tier 2 :Bookgreen: equipment.

items.name: Steel arrow
items.freeText: [[Arrow]] are required for [[Bow|bows]]. They are obtained by opening a [[Steel Arrows Pack]].

items.name: Steel arrows pack
items.freeText: When opened with /use_511 it yields 100 [[Steel Arrow|Steel Arrows]]. Arrow packs can only be crafted and not traded in any way.

items.name: Steel axe
items.description: With an axe at heart, it features a single 200 degree edge and a spike on the end of a 2' polearm. The weapon is shorter than a Halberd, but longer than an average hand axe, and much more effective at chopping wood AND adversaries. Some expertise is required to wield the axe, as a wrong swing will easily remove a leg.

items.name: Steel boots
items.description: The official shoe of the castle, itâ€™s a simplistic way to protect the feet of many soldiers. A Leather Shoe with ankle support, and an iron cover, it benefits greatly over the Sandal and Leather Shoe alone. Rather simplistic, it lacks any engravings or detail.

items.name: Steel dagger
items.description: Your first true dueling knife, how cute. Regular iron ore is smelted at a high temperature and all impurities are 'baked' away, and carbon is added to make steel. A golden/brass hilt with a small cross guard is wrapped with a small amount of cord for grip, and put together before forged into place. Voila, your sidearm is ready for combat!

items.name: Steel gauntlets
items.description: A full steel glove covers the external side of the hand and forearm, which faces enemies in combat. Held together by hinges and leather straps, the plates extend down the arm and consume the fingers similar to a glove. It provides excellent protection to the outside, but leaves the hand and inner arm exposed to not overencumber the weater

items.name: Steel helmet
items.description: A rather simplistic helmet it featured a leather cap similar to a cowl, except its laced to an iron like cup. A 'T' shaped cut in the middle allow the user to see, and speak clearly. Other than that, itâ€™s simply an iron bowl placed on the head.

items.name: Steel mold
items.freeText: It is used in various recipes for the Tier 2 :Bookgreen: equipment.

items.name: Stick of Wisdom
items.description: A smart stick. Given out to those who helped create the encyclopedia of the land, or wiki, detailing all armors, weapons, events, craftables, resources, and parts... A laborous task. About the size of a staff, it's capped with an energizing green orb, giving the wielder extra stamina and seemingly luck. Thank you for helping!
items.freeText: It is a a special reward given to selected players for working on the chatwars wiki. It gives +2 :Stamina: stamina and +2 :Luck: luck. Also there are only 2 of this item in the seven kingdoms

items.name: Storm Cloak
items.description: Nicknamed the Storm Cloak due to an accident in a thunderstorm, the Storm Cloak is a favorite among assassins. Essentially a reinforced Royal Cape, it has a newly attached hood and metal weave to the inside. Capable of stopping some arrows and most dagger strikes, many people enjoy the added protection.
items.freeText: It was introduced in the [[Game updates/2018-06-30|June 30th, 2018 game update]].

items.name: Thundersoul Sword
items.description: With a name like Thundersoul, you'd expect it to spark. A mithril-steel hybrid fades from dark blue to shining steel at the tip, and is etched with zig-zagging lines of imitation lightning outlined in white, before darkening as it fades to the steel. A bold 3 and a half feet long, it's nicknamed Thunder due to the crackling produced during forging.
items.freeText: It was introduced with the [[Game_updates/2018-06-30|June 30th, 2018 game update]]

items.name: Thundersoul Sword recipe
items.freeText: It was introduced in the [[Game updates/2018-06-30|June 30th, 2018 game update]].

items.name: Torch
items.freeText: Equipping a torch in the [[Weapon|Off Hand Weapon]] slot reduces the time of the [[Quest|quests]] in :Forest:[[Forest]], :Swamp:[[Swamp]] and :Valley:[[Valley]] by 1 minute, but only at night [[Time|time]] (see /time). Torches can randomly break during quests.

items.freeText: This bell is part of the [[Trade Union Event 2019]] and is used to find the special resource [[Artisan Goods]] in quests. It can be crafted with /tu_bell for 250 :Gold:.

items.wikiNote: needs weight, effect added and error checking
items.effect: It increases the amount of resources found in [[Quest|quests]].
items.freeText: It increases the amount of resources found in [[Quest|quests]].

items.name: Vial of Health
items.effect: Increases [[Character#Health|health]] regeneration by 27% per minute
items.wikiFreeText: Alchemists without specialisation (non-guru) that have acquired [[Alchemy (Skill)#Skill_caps|Alchemy lvl.5]] will require 600 :mana: to brew this item. The mana cost decreases as you get closer to guru.

items.name: Vial of Mana
items.wikiNote: needs weight added and error checking
items.effect: +1 [[Mana]] regeneration per minute over potion duration.
items.freeText: This potion does not work for Esquire classes, as they do not possess any mana.

items.name: Vial of Morph
items.wikiNote: needs weight added and error checking
items.effect: Decreases [[Character#Stats|base stats]] by 30% and swaps them (Attack becomes Defense and vice versa)
items.wikiFreeText:
=Note=
Being morphed swaps base stats and reduces them by 35%; Vial of morph restores them by +5%, finally giving 30% reduced stats.

* When stacked together with a [[Potion of Morph]], the final stat reduction is 20%.
* When stacked together with a [[Bottle of Morph]], the final stat reduction is 15%.
* When stacked together with both [[Potion of Morph|Vial]] and [[Bottle of Morph|Potion]] of morph, the final stat reduction is 5%.

items.name: Vial of Nature
items.wikiNote: needs weight added and error checking
items.effect: Increase [[Harvest]] level by 1

items.effect: Increase [[Character#Stats|base defense]] by 5% (floored to next lowest integer)
items.freeText: It is brewed by [[Alchemist|alchemists]] and increases the defensive stats of the player.

items.name: Vial of Rage
items.wikiNote: needs weight added and error checking

items.wikiNote: needs weight added and error checking
items.effect: 10%{{citation needed}} chance to get night loot drops outside of the night
items.freeText: When using the potion you have a chance of obtaining resources that otherwise only drop at night at any time of day.

items.name: War hammer
items.description: Motivated from the barbarians that wielded them, the War Hammer has been modified for mass production and longer use. The hammer sits upon a wooden pole with iron plates for grip, the dull triangles used to bash and decimate armor and shields alike. Due to the lower quality materials, its a favorite among those who need to repair weapons quickly.
items.freeText: It was introduced in the [[Game_updates/2018-04-03|April 3, 2018 update]].

items.name: War hammer head
items.wikiNote: Missing drop info before conversion just 'Swamp' was specified.
items.freeText: It was introduced in the [[Advanced Crafting]] update.

items.name: War hammer recipe
items.freeText: It was introduced in the [[Advanced Crafting]] update.

items.name: ðŸ§Ÿâ€â™‚ï¸ Werewolf Helmet
items.description: Similar to a Lion Helmet, except wolf like. A steel helmet is made as a base, before a fake mouth and skull are formed and added. With fur, it resembles a wolf's head. Offering all around protection intimidation even without a full set, many users value the animalistic style of this helmet. Users are advised to avoid adding silver trim, however.
items.wikiNote: needs info added on which update it was introduced

items.name: ðŸ§Ÿâ€â™‚ï¸ Werewolf Knife
items.wikiFreeText:
=Acquisition=
The item can be obtained via stage 2 of the {{#show: {{PAGENAME}} |?Event }} special event. Once a monster horde is defeated there is a possibility to get the {{PAGENAME}}.

items.name: Widow sword
items.description: A rather popular design, most popular among the upper class of the castle. A thin, slightly curved blade similar to a Rapier extends to a single, sharp point. A web like hand guard wraps around the handle. The thin, whispy blade is popular among castle royalty and duelists, for the blade's beauty and light weight in parades and shows.

items.name: Windstalker Bow
items.ammunition: Bodkin Arrow, Mechblade Arrow, Piercing Arrow

items.name: Windstalker Bow part
items.wikiNote: new item, not much data known

items.name: Wooden arrow
items.freeText: [[Arrow]] are required for [[Bow|bows]]. They are obtained by opening a [[Wooden Arrows Pack]].

items.name: Wooden arrows pack
items.freeText: When opened with /use_505 it yields 100 [[Wooden Arrow|Wooden Arrows]]. Arrow packs can only be crafted and not traded in any way.

items.name: Wooden Bow
items.description: Stepping into modern times, a branch is stripped and treated, before slowly bent into place to bottle energy. Then, a string is attached from top to bottom, and tested. Adjustments are made, and the bow is ready for fighting. Different wood types can change the color of the bow, and certain dyes/oils can be applied to make a shiny finish.
items.freeText: To use the {{PAGENAME}}, {{#show: {{PAGENAME}} |?Ammunition}} needs to be equipped in the Off Hand Weapon slot.

items.name: Wooden shaft
items.freeText: It was introduced in the [[Advanced Crafting]] update.

items.name: Wooden shield
items.description: Oak planks are sanded and treated with oil to resist water before being laid side by side. Laying vertically, two horizontal boards are added and then nailed to hold the wood together. Leather straps are fastened to the supporting wood, intended to be worn on the arm. Cheap and low quality, youre almost better off without the extra weight.
items.freeText: Unlike other [[Weapon|weapons]] the {{PAGENAME}} is listed under ''Equipment'' in the [[Shop|shop]] and not weapons, but it uses the [[Weapon|Off Hand Weapon]] slot to be equipped, as all other [[Weapon|weapons]] do.

items.name: Wooden sword
items.description: Essentially a stick, the wooden baton like weapon is cut and sanded down, with a smooth handle, no hilt, and a 3 foot bladeâ€¦ of curved wood. Mostly for training, it can do blunt damage against an unarmored foe.

items.name: Wrapping
items.freeText: It is required to [[Wrap|wrap]] items for [[Auction|auctions]].

items.wikiFreeText:
=Flavor Text=
 Appearing as if an extension of the torso, white metalled bones from the rib cage peek out from behind green tinted rawhide, scaley and tough and acting as a skin. Despite anatomy, the bones extend downwards, and wrap around to protect the user's stomach, creating a top of the line armor for the one lucky enough to get their hands on a set.

items.name: Rare Scroll of Engraving
items.freeText: It is used to add or change a postfix to the name of a [[Equipment#Equipment slots|main hand weapon]] item. The {{PAGENAME}} can be obtained in various Events, but is not limited to the duration of said event.
items.wikiFreeText: Two scrolls (Prefix and Postfix) can`t be combined only one of the two types can be used.

items.name: Bottle of Oblivion
items.wikiFreeText: The '''Bottle of Oblivion''' is a [[Consumable|consumable item]] that is available in the [[Shop]] in the category :Gem: Luxory. For 30 :Gem: [[Gems]], this bottle allows to reset all [[Skill|skillpoints]] of one chosen skill of a player. '''BUG: You can't use Bottle of Oblivion if skill has level above 16!'''

items.name: Vial of Oblivion
items.wikiFreeText: The '''Vial of Oblivion''' is a [[Consumable|consumable item]] that is available in the [[Shop]] in the category :Gem: Luxory. For 3 :Gem: [[Gems]]. This bottle allows to reset one [[Skill|skillpoint]] of one chosen skill of a player.
